description: When downgrading migration 203 the indexes ix_quota_usages_user_id_deleted and ix_reservations_user_id_deleted on quota_usages and reservations aren't removed. This causes an error when downgrading and then upgrading again as the indexes already exist.
title: Migration 203 downgrade doesn't remove indexes

comments.content: When downgrading migration 203 the indexes ix_quota_usages_user_id_deleted and ix_reservations_user_id_deleted on quota_usages and reservations aren't removed. This causes an error when downgrading and then upgrading again as the indexes already exist.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~joshua.hesketh

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/39714
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/39714
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/168f1b76a558dd5586277446a24e4f9b72c7062a
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 168f1b76a558dd5586277446a24e4f9b72c7062a
Author: Joshua Hesketh <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Aug 2 00:06:40 2013 +1000

    Remove the indexes on downgrade to work with MySQL
    
    Fixes MySQL downgrade on migration 203.
    Add tests to check the indexes.
    
    Fixes bug 1207174
    
    Change-Id: If50fb49e1c76c2a7512141dae5f1a5818dc1b699
